message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public int summation(int[] array) {
    Iterator<Integer> iterator = Arrays.stream(array).iterator();
    return summationHelper(iterator);
}

private int summationHelper(Iterator<Integer> iterator) {
    if (!iterator.hasNext()) {
        return 0;
    }
    return iterator.next() + summationHelper(iterator);
}

<<<explanation>>>: In this solution, we use an iterator to iterate over the elements of the array. The summationHelper method is a recursive function that takes the iterator as a parameter. It checks if the iterator has a next element, if not, it returns 0. Otherwise, it adds the current element to the result and calls itself recursively with the iterator pointing to the next element. This way, we can achieve recursion without using an index variable.
